title: Accessibility Regulations & Standards
subtitle: Key international standards and legal requirements for academic publishing

perceivable.title: Perceivable
perceivable.description: Information and UI components must be presentable to users in ways they can perceive.
perceivable.examples: Text alternatives (images, charts, etc.), Time-based media alternatives, Contrast ratio 4.5:1+ (regular text), Non-text content contrast 3:1+, Adjustable text size (up to 200%)

operable.title: Operable
operable.description: UI components and navigation must be operable by users.
operable.examples: All functions keyboard accessible, Sufficient time provided, No seizure-inducing content, Clear navigation and search, Support for various input methods

understandable.title: Understandable
understandable.description: Information and UI operation must be understandable.
understandable.examples: Readable text, Predictable behavior, Clear error messages, Input assistance and error prevention, Consistent navigation patterns

robust.title: Robust
robust.description: Content must be robust enough to be interpreted by various user agents.
robust.examples: Valid HTML markup, Appropriate ARIA labels, Compatibility with assistive technologies, Use of standard web technologies, Clear states and properties

contrast.title: 1.4.3 Contrast (Minimum) - Level AA
contrast.description: Text and images of text must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 with the background.

nonText.title: 1.4.11 Non-text Contrast - Level AA
nonText.description: UI components and graphical objects must have a minimum 3:1 contrast ratio with adjacent colors.
items: Buttons, input fields, and other UI elements

june2025.title: EU Accessibility Act (EAA) Implementation
june2025.description: Mandatory accessibility standards for all digital products and services

oct2025.title: Tagged PDF Mandatory for Journals
oct2025.description: All new papers must comply with PDF/UA standard

jan2026.title: Full Open Access Transition
jan2026.description: All publications immediately free and accessible with accessibility standards applied

apr2026.title: All Content Accessibility Compliance
apr2026.description: All content including archives must achieve WCAG 2.2 AA or higher

elsevier.name: Elsevier
elsevier.description: Comprehensive accessibility standards and AI tool support

note.title: Important Note
note.content: Academic publishing is rapidly moving toward mandatory accessibility compliance. Starting in 2025, many major publishers will require WCAG 2.2 Level AA compliance and PDF/UA tagged PDFs. Preparing accessible documents from the start will save time and ensure smooth publication.
